--- title: "Data Cleaning" author: "Crystal Lewis, Shannon Pileggi, & Peter Higgins" footer: "[Data Cleaning](https://shannonpileggi.github.io/rmedicine-data-cleaning-2023)" logo: "images/R-Med-logo-revised-pride.png" editor: source format: revealjs: theme: slides.scss transition: fade slide-number: true chalkboard: true execute: echo: true freeze: auto cache: true --- # Introduction ::: {.cell} ::: ## Licensing
This work is licensed under [Creative Commons Zero v1.0 Universal](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/). ## Instructors ::: columns ::: {.column width="33%"} **Crystal Lewis** ![](images/Crystal_circle.png){width="70%"} ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} **Shannon Pileggi** ![](images/Shannon_circle.png){width="70%"} ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} **Peter Higgins** ![](images/Peter_circle.jpg){width="70%"} ::: ::: ## Checklist
``{=html} Install recent R release Current version 4.3.0 ``{=html} Install RStudio I am on version 2022.07.1+554 ``{=html} Install packages ``` r # install.packages(c("gtreg", "gtsummary", "tidyverse", "labelled", "usethis")) ``` ``{=html} Ensure you can knit Rmarkdown files ## Schedule | Time | Activity | |:--------------|:-------------------| | 09:00 - 09:50 | Section 1 | | 09:50 - 10:00 | *Break* | | 10:00 - 10:50 | Section 2 | | 10:50 - 11:00 | *Break* | | 11:00 - 12:00 | Section 3 |
Please add any questions to the public Zoom chat. These may be answered in the moment or addressed at the end depending on context. # Crystal Section A ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Crystal Section B ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Stage 1 cleaning ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-2_454f016262909bcc390718c0b5c5aea0'} ::: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-3_f2ce1cecded57c226a27faa973d1d7b3'} ::: ## new thing ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-4_0f96c975077a727189de3f486fe1c20f'} ```{.r .cell-code} mtcars |> tibble::as_tibble() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 32 √ó 11 mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb 1 21 6 160 110 3.9 2.62 16.5 0 1 4 4 2 21 6 160 110 3.9 2.88 17.0 0 1 4 4 3 22.8 4 108 93 3.85 2.32 18.6 1 1 4 1 4 21.4 6 258 110 3.08 3.22 19.4 1 0 3 1 5 18.7 8 360 175 3.15 3.44 17.0 0 0 3 2 6 18.1 6 225 105 2.76 3.46 20.2 1 0 3 1 7 14.3 8 360 245 3.21 3.57 15.8 0 0 3 4 8 24.4 4 147. 62 3.69 3.19 20 1 0 4 2 9 22.8 4 141. 95 3.92 3.15 22.9 1 0 4 2 10 19.2 6 168. 123 3.92 3.44 18.3 1 0 4 4 # ‚Ñπ 22 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## Variable names Original variable names in excel: ![](images/var_names_1.PNG) . . . Variable names import as shown, with modifications from `readxl::read_excel()` to ensure uniqueness: ![](images/var_names_2.PNG) ## Variable names, cleaner Variable names as imported: ![](images/var_names_2.PNG) . . . `janitor::clean_names()` removes special characters and implements snake case by default: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-5_1a77cc9a2e5bfa8e9f5be1ee2d489cc8'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_raw |> janitor::clean_names() ``` ::: ![](images/var_names_3.PNG) ## Recoding ::: panel-tabset ### Problem ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-6_9bd8c05d7bd1f3b0a5fd53f63a3eafc8'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_clean <- df_raw |> janitor::clean_names() df_clean |> count(ethnic) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 √ó 2 ethnic n 1 Hispanic 1 2 NOT hispanic 1 3 hispamnic 1 4 hispanic 3 5 not hispanic 24 6 1 ``` ::: ::: ### Solution ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-7_bc8545ead1503ff333c0be8f3f7075ea'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_clean <- df_raw |> janitor::clean_names() |> mutate( ethnic_clean = case_when( ethnic %in% c("hispanic", "Hispanic", "hispamnic") ~ "hispanic", ethnic %in% c("NOT hispanic", "not hispanic") ~ "not hispanic", ) ) df_clean |> count(ethnic_clean) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 √ó 2 ethnic_clean n 1 hispanic 5 2 not hispanic 25 3 1 ``` ::: ::: ### Confirm ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-8_7c1a9da26a5b94f6bfb1e2d9cdb14da0'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_clean |> count(ethnic_clean, ethnic) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 √ó 3 ethnic_clean ethnic n 1 hispanic Hispanic 1 2 hispanic hispamnic 1 3 hispanic hispanic 3 4 not hispanic NOT hispanic 1 5 not hispanic not hispanic 24 6 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Wrangling your Data ## Deciding on the Unit of Observation Image ## Is it the Patient? - Patient over time - Outcome colectomy - labs over time ## Is it the Visit/Encounter? - Patient over time - Outcome colectomy - labs over time ## Reshaping your data with tidyr ## Pivoting Longer (common) - Visit Dates/Measures - Your Turn (Exercise) ## Pivoting Wider # Filling in Unobserved Dates/Times with padr ## Padding unobserved dates (weekends?) ## Padding unovserved times ## Joins of data from different sources ## Local Demographics with CDC SVI data (one to one) ## Patient Demographics with Lab results (one to many) # Duncan Section A ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Duncan Section B ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 ## Thank you! üôè [Click here to submit workshop feedback](https://forms.gle/kvEirN7sJmavem8q6){target="_blank"}

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
